TopicTitle: I want to have a space war. But how can I do that?

Articles.Content: I came up with the idea of having a stock (and DLC) space war and roleplay thing with people. but i have no clue how I should execute it... So I want to ask people of the KSP community if they have ideas and if they want to join. Should I use multiplayer mod? But that has issues when people aren't online and I dont have a server. Or we could agree on a set time and in-game location for a battle? But that would be hard with a large group of people and wouldn't fit roleplay really wel. or safefile passing? but then people cant defend themselfes... Anyone have suggestions?

Maybe you should have multiple people first write a battle together, and then actually conduct the battle in KSP? I would love to help you in the writing part of it. Gonna follow you BTW.

Perhaps you could do a Career-style war, where you have to fight to be the first to Duna. Everyone starts on Kerbin, at a different launch pad. Everyone is the same distance from each other. And you take turns launching something. But only one thing. It can be a plane, rocket, or missile. And your turn to launch something ends when you stage your craft for the first time.

I'm not sure exactly how the community works, but if my understanding is correct, the folks over at /r/KerbalPowers (https://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalPowers/) have an RP world thing going on, and may be able to point you in the direction of some like minded people.  I believe it was created after RP stuff was banned from the KSP forums. I assume they have some sort of discord or other forum that they use to coordinate everything. I also can't speak to whether or not they feature space wars per se, but it could be a good place to start.

Hi @minerbat.

I know you like the idea. But real world KSP engines/rockets and moving solar system are going to make this very hard to realise. But don't despair, there is a possibility in a single player game that maybe can be expanded to multiplayer by those of you who know how to set this up.

You are going to need at minimum the mod Next Star Industries version 2.4.2  Specifically their TDS22 and the module they created to make it work. It is a replica of the ship from the movie Flight of the Navigator, It can fly just like it, straight out of atmosphere and out of solar system at eventually millions of m/s. No running out of fuel, no rcs needed. Just don't go too far from Kerbin because even though unlimited and powerful thrust sounds fun. Trying to plot an intercept course, not to mention slow from a million m/s with that sort of propulsion is Super Genius territory. They also have a Death Star and the ability to make Tie Fighters.

Any battle would best be in the space between Kerbin and the Mun if you want your victors to return or not just get plain Lost In Space.

Hope this helps you realise your vision.

In the space above Kerbin, 2 warring factions are about to meet. One is in a prograde orbit, the other in a retrograde orbit. It's often called Space Jousting by observers....

"Open Fire!"

"Aye Sir, firing!....oh no, we missed Captain!"

"Ok, let's do another 5 day orbit and try again".

5 days later.....

"Captain, we're coming up on the ship again!"

"Ok....erm why were we trying to shoot them again?"

"Can't remember to be honest Captain. Anyway, we've got new orders through from HQ, they want us to investigate a potential rebel base on Eeloo!"

"Ok, helm set a course for Eeloo,  send our ETA to HQ"

"Aye Sir, course engaged, sending.... 3 years and 350 days... "

"Nearly 4 years you say....? Helm, forget that, let's just hang around the dark side of the Mun for a bit till this is all over, they'll never know."

"Aye Sir".

and so? why can long battles not be fun when timewarp is a thing? it would make things interesting because when there is a battle at a place far away, you cant easily send new ships there fast, so you have to do with what is already there and plan way ahead by making sure you have ships in strategic locations long before a battle. and trying to be at least somewhat fast is a cool engineering and orbit challenge (a ship that flies on a jool transfer orbet, but encounters duna instead will be there faster than a ship that is on a classic transfer to duna). and kerbals dont care, because in my imagination they go in a type of hibernation and get their energy from photosynthesis on long missions and get awake once they arrive.

I wasn’t knocking your idea, was just being facetious as that’s what popped in my head when I read your statement.

However, what you’re suggesting would be very unique. Look at any space battle on film, they all ignore the laws of physics and make it like jets dogfighting on Earth as that’s fun and exciting to watch. I see your idea as more like a chess game in space (again not a criticism) which could be interesting in it’s own way.
